subject: Gardening
title: Thorns, Spines, and Prickles
description: Learn Thorns, Spines, and Prickles in one minute.

hook.text: Roses have prickles, cacti have spines, and hawthorns have thorns. They look alike but are completely different.

buildup.text: Thorns are modified stems. Spines are modified leaves. Prickles are outgrowths of the barkâ€”surface only.

discovery.text: This matters: thorns and spines are deeply rooted and impossible to snap off. Prickles break off easily.

twist.text: Some acacias grow longer thorns on branches grazed by animalsâ€”and shorter thorns on untouched branches. They adapt.

climax.text: Physical defenses cost energy. Plants invest in armor only where the threat is realâ€”a targeted defense budget.

punchline.text: Plants grow armor where they're attacked most.

quiz.question: What is the botanical difference between thorns and prickles?
options: Thorns are modified stems; prickles are bark outgrowths that break off easily
Thorns are found only on trees; prickles only on shrubs
Thorns contain poison; prickles are purely mechanical
